##### An example of how Python and R can be used together through the use of reticulate
##### Load R Reticulate library
```{r}
library(reticulate)
```

##### Import the Numpy library from Python
```{python}
import numpy as np
mat1=np.array([[1,2],[3,4]])
```

##### Calculate the Inverse matrix in R using the numpy matrix from Python
```{r}
mat2<-solve(py$mat1)
mat2
```
##### Back to Python- using matrix multiplication to find the Inverse Matrix
```{python}
np.dot(mat1,r.mat2).round()
```
